sentence.idiomatic: I really want to go see their live performance.
Hurry, the live broadcast is about to start.
If I were able to see their live performance that would be great.
I have never liked rock and roll music.
They held a rock and roll concert recently.
These rock and roll songs are great. Have a listen and see.
Tonight’s performance was truly great!
What performances are there these days?
I have two tickets for tonight’s performance. Let’s go to see it together.
Let’s go to the bar for a couple of drinks tonight, shall we?
He found a job in a bar.
They went to the bar together for a drink.
I’ve heard that this band is really popular recently. Have you ever heard their songs?
After she quit her job she started a band.
She is fascinated by this band, and listens to its songs every day.
The opera she wrote obtained great success.
In the twenty years since he started to write, he has already published more than ten novels.
These songs you wrote are very good.
I’ve heard that you studied dance. Please show us something.
He will show off his new clothes at the party.
I’ll perform a song for everyone that I've just learned.
Do you know where has live rock concerts?
At the bars there should be some. What kind do you want to see?
Local bands that compose and sing their own music.
Then it would be best go to an area with lots of bars. Wherever it’s more happening, there should be some.
Do you usually not like to see live concerts?
They’re all right. But I think live music is too noisy, so I don’t really go see it.
As for me, no matter where I go, I always like to experience the local rock scene firsthand, because I used to be in a band.

word.literal: to not be able to tell

sentence.idiomatic: Really? I really couldn’t tell! If there’s a chance you’ll have to perform something.

word.literal: to work or study in the arts
to work or study in cinema
